meanings.sent1: During the sale, there were mases of people in the store.
meanings.sent2: She had mases of books in her library.
meanings.sent3: The picnic had mases of delicious food for everyone to enjoy.
meanings.sent4: The city streets were filled with mases of cars during rush hour.
meanings.sent5: The concert drew mases of fans from all over the country.

meanings.sent1: The chef prepared a delicious soup with a mases of vegetables.
meanings.sent2: She spread the mases of icing on the cake.
meanings.sent3: The artist mixed mases of colors to create a unique painting.
meanings.sent4: The construction worker applied a mases of cement to the wall.
meanings.sent5: The skincare product had a mases of moisturizing ingredients.

meanings.definition: To gather together in a mass
meanings.sent1: The protesters decided to mases in front of the government building.
meanings.sent2: The students will mases in the auditorium for the assembly.
meanings.sent3: The birds will mases in the trees before migrating south.
meanings.sent4: The fans will mases at the stadium to support their team.
meanings.sent5: The workers will mases at the strike to demand fair wages.
